ygData.subject: Re: Another suggestion
ygData.msgSnippet: ... SK ... Is it too powerful because of their low agility? They get hit a lot and so a damage shield would be too effective? Is that it? And just a quick poll
ygData.messageBody:
> You are correct, the damage shields were far too powerful if put on a big
SK
> (ogre/troll). Your comments about Shadow Step are interesting.

Is it too powerful because of their low agility? They get hit a lot and so a
damage shield would be too effective? Is that it?

And just a quick poll of my own -- How many troll/ogre SKs do we have here?
I'm a dark elf, and I know Cro is a troll. What about the rest of you guys?

> Lifetap/spike/draw would be used near the end of a melee in a group -- you
> could use it as a quick heal to minimize downtime.
>
> And personally, it has always been my idea that an SK feeds off the life
> force of the weak, so after a fight walking around and sucking the life
out
> of gnolls and orcs sounds very in character...

True, but in a DUNGEON situation, where you WILL be after say level 30,
there aren't any gnolls or orcs just wandering around waiting to be
vampired. So the only things you could lifetap would be those mobs that
you're actually fighting. And then you get back into the pull-back-to-cast
tactic that so many of us despise. I'm still pushing for damage shields. :)

Dravith Vandre'i
